name: 朴維鎮
objective: ‘Analysis and decision making using data’ course deals with various analysis and decision-making techniques using data. Recent years have seen an explosion of the amount of data available to everyone, and making sense of that data has become an operational imperative. The tools of statistics are one of the ways we can make sense of the data and use it to make more effective decisions. So, this course focuses on information and data engineering, computational reasoning applied, and enterprise decision management to the design of decision support systems, information extraction, and data mining. It implements the use of computers to discover patterns in data. Thus, in this course we will introduce the concepts of descriptive and inferential statistics, several efficient prediction techniques such as regression analysis, and their use in decision making.

Week 3 Basic statistics Part II: Random variables, mean, median, standard deviation, variance, correlation, covariance 
Week 4 Basic statistics Part III: Hypothesis tests
Week 5 Basic statistics Part IV: Hypothesis tests
Week 6 Simple linear regression – Part I
Week 7 Simple linear regression – Part II
Week 8 Simple linear regression – Part III
Week 9 Interim presentation of individual project and submission of interim report
Week 10 Multiple linear regression – Part I
Week 11 Multiple linear regression – Part II
Week 12 Multiple linear regression – Part III
Week 13 Paper discussion – Part I
Week 14 Paper discussion – Part II
Week 15 Paper discussion – Part III
Week 16 Presentation I
Week 17 Presentation II
Week 18 Presentation III
